Package opennlp.ccg.alignment

This package provides classes for modeling alignments between two phrases.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
EncodingScheme An encoding scheme for mappings.
 

Class Summary
AbstractEncodingScheme Abstract class for implementing encoding schemes.
Alignment An alignment consisting of a pair of phrases and a set of mappings between them.
Alignments Static non-instantiable class that provides convenience methods for reading and writing phrases, mappings, and alignments.
IdentifiedPhraseReader Phrase reader for phrases that have an identifier in addition to a line number, usually formatted by markup like
IdentifiedPhraseWriter A writer for phrases with ids in addition to numbers.
Mapping A mapping from an index in the A phrase position to an index in the B phrase position.
MappingFormat A class for formatting mappings according to an encoding scheme and a specified set of formatting fields.
MappingFormat.Field Marks mapping fields like ID, first index, second index, etc.
MappingGroup Class for representing groups of mappings during reading or writing.
MappingReader Class for reading Mappings from an underlying reader based on a specified MappingFormat.
MappingWriter A writer for outputting Mappings to a specified underlying Writer.
MosesEncodingScheme Represents the Moses encoding.
NAACLEncodingScheme Represents the NAACL shared task encoding.
Phrase A phrase, i.e., a sequence of words with an associated phrase number.
PhraseReader A phrase reader just reads line numbers, but does not search for phrase IDs.
PhraseWriter A writer for phrases.
 

Enum Summary
IndexBase A set of Enum constants representing the two common indexing bases used in representing alignments.
PhrasePosition In an alignment, a phrase position indicates which of the two aligned phrases is first (the "A" phrase) and which is second (the "B" phrase) in terms of the alignment indices.
Status A set of Enum constants for describing the status of a mapping, either as Status.POSSIBLE or Status.SURE.
 

Package opennlp.ccg.alignment Description

This package provides classes for modeling alignments between two phrases.

The Phrase class models a phrase as simply a list of words. A single alignment between an index in one phrase and an index in another is captured by the Mapping class. The Alignment class is build on top of Phrase and Mapping, encapsulating an "A" phrase and a "B" phrase along with a set of mappings between them (see PhrasePosition).

Since there are multiple different encoding schemes for representing alignments, a goal of this package is to make the conceptual representation of aligned phrases as independent of encoding as possible. The interface EncodingScheme gives a way to represent encoding schemes, and two popular encoding schemes (Moses and NAACL) are provided by this package. Different encoding schemes use different numbering bases: some start numbering indices at 0 and some at 1. To reconcile this difference, the class IndexBase provides a way to translate different numbering bases into a common index base. The MappingFormat class extends Format to give encoding-independent formatting and parsing for mappings.

The classes PhraseReader and PhraseWriter (and their descendants), MappingReader and MappingWriter provide convenient ways to read and write phrases and mappings. Lastly, the non-instantiable class Alignments provides some convenience methods for reading phrases, mappings and alignments.
